How shld reform of Child Act 1991 aim 2 improve provision 4 ch. in care of state? Point 7: issue of whether huge (+important ) effort by @HIQA inspections is really delivering a corresponding improvement in lived exper. + outcomes 4 children in care. need 4 more focus on outcomes
@IDickson258 @NicolaSturgeon absolutely, and with the resolute and unrelenting support of those who share the deep concern for the rights of children in care everywhere.

How shld reform of Child Act 1991 aim 2 improve provision 4 children in care of state? Point 6 strong focus - cast iron mechanism 4 resolving turf wars abt responsibility between @tusla +other public bodies @hse @Education_Ire etc w. urgency + in favour of child in care #Ireland
@IDickson258 @NicolaSturgeon Not just England (I know that is important to you!) - but this is really a message that is relevant everywhere #Ireland etc

How shld reform of Child Act 1991 aim 2 improve provision 4 children in care of state? Pt 5 strong focus on whole of govt. approach 2 supporting progress of children in care @tusla clearly pivotal, but all public agencies must play their relevant part @HSELive @Education_Ire etc

How should reform of Child Act 1991 aim 2 improve provision 4 children in care of state? Point 3 strong focus on needs of children with disabilities who are in also in care - physical+intellectual. @DCYAPress @KZapponeTD @ChildRightsIRL #UNCRPD @epicireland @tusla @CC_IHREC

How shld reform of Child Act 1991 aim 2 improve provision 4 children in care of state? Point 3 Re-imagining+benchmarking ambitiously+honestly role, function+capacity of Children's Court system in lives of children in care against best international practice @DCYAPress @KZapponeTD

How should reform of Child Act 1991 aim 2 improve provision 4 children in care of state? Point 2 strong focus on high quality data to know what it really happening and how good are outcomes for children in care @DCYAPress @KZapponeTD

How should reform of Child Act 1991 aim 2 improve provision 4 children in care of state? Point 1 - strong focus on educational support + progession of children + young people in care. Crystal clear message from international research as to its importantce @DCYAPress @KZapponeTD

@epicireland @tusla In reform of Child Care Act 1991, let's make sure we bring Ireland in line with best international practice by allowing young people in care to remain in, or return to, care until age 21 @DCYAPress @KZapponeTD @ChildRightsIRL @tusla @MargaretTuite1 @AnneRabbitte @epicireland
